Interstroke unconditional stratified analysis for predictor

is_figure_unconditional_stratified_subgroups.Rd

Interstroke unconditional stratified analysis for predictor

is_figure_unconditional_stratified_subgroups(
  interstroke_data,
  predictor,
  subgroups,
  model,
  limits = NULL,
  p_sig = NULL,
  breaks = NULL,
  text_size = NULL,
  drop_columns = NULL,
  include_overall = TRUE,
  long_title = TRUE
)

Arguments

interstroke_data

Project specific Interstroke dataset.
predictor

Interstroke predictor of interest for stratified analysis.
subgroups

A list of subgroups for stratified analysis.
model

Model formula for analysis. Predictor should be first independant variable.
limits

**Optional** Limit the x axis in the format c(xmin, xmax).
p_sig

**Optional** Set the level of significance to hide non significant values. Default displays all p values <1.
breaks

**Optional** Set the sequence for breaks in the format seq(xmin, xmax, interval)
text_size

**Optional** Assign value for text size.
drop_columns

**Optional** Drop population and subgroup columns suitable for joint plots.
long_title

**Optional** Set to false to just display predictor as title

Value

A dataframe suitable for Interstroke forest ggplot function.

Examples

is_figure_unconditional_stratified_subgroups(interstroke_data=interstroke_bmi, predictor=whr, subgroups=c("esex","smoking","alcohfreqcat","antihypertpre","cardiacrfcat"), model=case_num~whr+esex+smoking)

#> Error in `contrasts<-`(`*tmp*`, value = contr.funs[1 + isOF[nn]]): contrasts can be applied only to factors with 2 or more levels
